meanings.definition: To devour food quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog wolfed down his dinner in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She wolfed her sandwich during the short lunch break.
meanings.sent3: The kids wolfed their snacks like they had never eaten before.
meanings.sent4: He wolfed the pizza as if it was the last meal on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The bear in the story wolfed the porridge, leaving nothing for the others.

meanings.definition: To eat something very quickly and in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: After the game, the players wolfed the pizza slices in celebration.
meanings.sent2: The students wolfed the cookies at the school bake sale.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon wolfed the berries from the bush, not leaving any for the birds.
meanings.sent4: She wolfed the ice cream, not caring about brain freeze.
meanings.sent5: The ants wolfed the crumbs on the picnic blanket, working together efficiently.
